context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and approve orders to progress business workflows.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: This use case enables managers to approve orders, ensuring that business processes are not delayed.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Selected orders are approved and processed.
Order status is updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system includes an authentication process.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
The system shall authenticate managers before allowing order approval.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific criteria for order approval.
main_flow: 1. Manager initiates the order approval process → System displays pending orders for approval.
2. Manager selects an order to approve → System highlights the selected order details.
3. Manager confirms the approval of the order → System updates the order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the manager is not authenticated, the system prompts for authentication before displaying pending orders.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the order approval fails, the system displays an error message and retains the order status.
